methods.signature: cartesian_nonlinear_laplacian(expr, II, derivweights, s::MethodOfLines.DiscreteSpace{N}, b, depvars, x, u)

children: , return the correct finite difference equation for the nonlinear laplacian at the location in the grid given by
The inner derivative is discretized with the half offset centered scheme, giving the derivative at interpolated grid points offset by dx/2 from the regular grid.
The outer derivative is discretized with the centered scheme, giving the nonlinear laplacian at the grid point
. For first order returns something like this:
For 4th order, returns something like this:

first_finite_diffs = [a(x-3/2)*finitediff(u, i-3/2),
                      a(x-1/2)*finitediff(u, i-1/2),
                      a(x+1/2)*finitediff(u, i+1/2),
                      a(x+3/2)*finitediff(u, i+3/2)]

dot(central_finite_diff_weights, first_finite_diffs)
is the finite difference at the interpolated point
